section.p:
The EJBDeploy goal will generate a WebSphere specific stubs and ties, along with the IBM specific artifacts
ejb-jar.xml
ibm-ejb-jar-bnd.xmi

Running the EJBDeploy task from the commandline is done using the following syntax:
mvn clean install was5:EJBDeploy \ -DoutputJar=<mygeneratedjar-1.0.jar> \ -DinputJar=<myinputjar-1.0.jar> \ -DwasHome=<path to WebSphere installation>
section.h2: Running EJBDeploy with definition in pom
section.p:
Running the EJBDeploy task with the definition defined in the build section of the pom:
<dependencies> <dependency> <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId> <artifactId>was5-plugin</artifactId> <version>1.0</version> <scope>runtime</scope> </dependency> </dependencies>
<build> <plugins> <plugin> <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId> <artifactId>was5-plugin</artifactId> <version>1.0</version> <executions> <execution> <id>generate-deploycode</id> <phase>pre-integration-test</phase> <goals> <goal>EJBDeploy</goal> </goals> </execution> </executions> <configuration> <inputJar> ${artifactId}-${project.version}.jar </inputJar> <outputJar> ${artifactId}-${project.version}.jar </outputJar> <wasHome>C:/Programfiles/WebSphere/AppServer</wasHome> <targetWAS>WAS502</targetWAS> </configuration> </plugin> </plugins> </build>
